category_id: Services: Printing, Publishing, Mailing, Subscription, Books and Periodical Bids
title: Publication of the City of Irvine Legal Notices in a Regional Newspaper
description:
CITY OF IRVINE, CALIFORNIA
NOTICE INVITING BIDS SUMMARY
Bid No. 22-3252

DESCRIPTION OF WORK: The work to be performed shall include, but not be limited to:
Publication of the City of Irvine Legal Notices in a Regional Newspaper of General Circulation in the County of Orange, including the City of Irvine, during Fiscal Year 2022-23. Requirements include:

Vendor must be adjudicated in Orange County

Legal notices must:

Circulate/publish in Orange County, including the City of Irvine

Publish in English

Publish at least seven (7) days per week

DATE OF OPENING BIDS: Bid prices must be entered on the BidsOnline system in accordance with the instructions no later than June 10, 2022, at 10:00 a.m., at which time bids will be publicly opened and read aloud via online meeting tool. LATE BIDS WILL NOT BE ACCEPTED. NO OTHER METHOD OF BID SUBMITTAL WILL BE ACCEPTED.

The City reserves the right, after opening bids, to reject any or all bids, to waive any informality in a bid, to make awards in the interest of the City, and to reject all other bids.

OBTAINING BID: To obtain a copy of the bid documents, please visit the City of Irvine web site at www.cityofirvine.org/purchasing. Click on the "Supplier Registration and Bid Opportunities" link, and review the information about our online system. Next, click on the "BidsOnline" link. If you are not currently registered with the City of Irvine, please click on the "New Vendor Registration" button and then complete the electronic supplier registration. After registering your firm, click on the "Bid Opportunities" button to view and download the Bid Documents, which include the complete Notice Inviting Bids document. Contractors must register on the City's web site and download the Bid Documents in order to submit a bid. Firms must also check the web site periodically for addenda information as failure to download any and all addenda and acknowledge receipt within the site will result in bid disqualification.

CITY OF IRVINE

By: /s/ Carl Petersen
Carl Petersen, MPA, CMC
City Clerk

title: Store, Ship and Distribute Smoking Cessation Printed Materials
buyer: Maryland Department of Health and Mental Hygiene
agency: Maryland Department of Health and Mental Hygiene
description: The Maryland Department of Health (MDH or the Department), Prevention and Health Promotion Administration, and Center for Tobacco Prevention and Control, is issuing this Invitation for Bids (IFB) for a Contractor to store and ship all tobacco prevention and control materials for the Department. Materials will be housed at the Contractor’s warehouse and distributed to local health departments, doctor’s offices, Maryland residents, providers, hospitals, worksites, churches, community groups and other stakeholders across Maryland. Materials shall be shipped on an ongoing basis, upon receipt of electronic, written, and faxed requests.

category_id: Services: Printing, Publishing, Mailing, Subscription, Books and Periodical Bids
title: Drug Database Licensing
buyer: Department of Health and Human Services
agency: Department of Health and Human Services
description: This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with the procedures contained in FAR Part 12.6, Acquisition of Commercial Items, and FAR Part 13, Simplified Acquisition Procedures, as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. This announcement constitutes the only solicitation; quotes are being requested and a written solicitation will not be issued. This acquisition is for the selected contractor to provide drug database licensing. (A) The solicitation number is 75N97022Q00034 and is issued as a Request for Quotation (RFQ). (B) The solicitation document and incorporated provisions and clauses are those in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular (FAC) Number 2022-05. (C) The associated NAICS code is 511199 and the size standard in number of employees is 500. (D) List CLINS, item descriptions, quantities and units of measure: See attached RFQ. (E) Description/Statement of Work/Specification: See attached RFQ. (F) FAR Provision 52.212-1, Instructions to Offerors-Commercial, is incorporated by reference and applies to this acquisition. Please see the attached RFQ terms and conditions for the submission requirements. (G) FAR Provision 52.212-2, Evaluation Commercial Products and Commercial Services, is incorporated by reference and applies to this acquisition. For the evaluation criteria, please see the attached RFQ terms and conditions. (H) Offerors are required to complete in full FAR Provision 52.212-3, Offeror Representations and Certifications-Commercial Items, with their offer online at SAM: www.sam.gov. An offeror must state in their offer if they completed FAR 52.212-3 online and that is it up-to-date and valid. See the attached RFQ terms and conditions for more requirements. (I) FAR Clause 52.212-4, Contract Terms and Conditions-Commercial Items, applies to this acquisition. Please see the attached RFQ terms and conditions for its Addendum. (J) FAR Clause 52.212-5, Contract Terms and Conditions Required to Implement Statutes or Executive Orders-Commercial Items, is incorporated and applies to this acquisition. Please see the attached RFQ terms and conditions that are applicable to the acquisition. (K) A statement regarding any additional contract requirement(s) or terms and conditions (such as contract financing arrangements or warranty requirements) determined by the contracting officer to be necessary for this acquisition and consistent with customary commercial practices: N/A. (L) Date, time and place offers are due.?Offers are due by June 7th, 2022 at 11:00 AM EST.? Submit offers to the following e-mail address(es), by the offer due date and time: Cameron Earle Cameron.earle@nih.gov and Karen Miller Karen.miller@nih.gov.

title: Various On Call Printing and Mailing Services
description:
Bid Title: 	RFP for Various On Call Printing and Mailing Services
Category: 	Office Supplies and Equipment
Status: 	Open

Description:
**This has been edited to update the location of the Bid Opening*** 3:00 PM June 6, 2022, Blue Springs City Hall, Room 203 Admin Lobby


Requests for Proposals (RFP)

On-Call Printing Services

May 25, 2022


The City of Blue Springs, Missouri requests proposals for professional printing services for the on-call printing and mailing distribution (when applicable) of various printed materials as outlined in this Request for Proposals upon request and as needed by the City. The successful Contractor will provide all materials, equipment, staffing, and supplies necessary to perform printing services for the items listed in response to this request for bids. Prices quoted by the contractor shall remain in effect for a one-year contract period (with option to renew for two additional years). The City shall supply City logos and any other pertinent artwork or information to the contractor.

This contract is tax exempt.


In accordance with the attached specifications, proposals must be received by and will be opened at: 3:00 PM June 6, 2022, Blue Springs City Hall, Room 203 Admin Lobby

Please mark on envelope “Printing Services: City of Blue Springs” and return to:

City of Blue Springs

Attn: Miranda Austerman, Communications Manager

903 W. Main Street

Blue Springs, MO 64015


Direct all questions regarding this Request for Proposal to Miranda Austerman by phoneor email at 816-655-0497 or mausterman@bluespringsgov.com.

The City reserves the right to reject any and all proposal(s) and to select the proposal(s) deemed most advantageous to the City.

FULL BID REQUIREMENTS HERE


Publication Date/Time:
5/25/2022 12:00 AM
Closing Date/Time:
6/6/2022 3:00 PM
Submittal Information:
City of Blue Springs Attn: Miranda Austerman, Communications Manager 903 W. Main Street Blue Springs
Contact Person:
Direct all questions regarding this Request for Proposal to Miranda Austerman by phone or email at 816-655-0497 or mausterman@bluespringsgov.com.

category_id: Services: Transport, Logistics, Hauling, Shipping, Warehousing, Moving Bids
title: Lituya Crew Transport
description:
ITB#2522S072 Lituya Crew Transport
The Department of Transportation and Public Facilities, Alaska Marine Highway System (AMHS) is soliciting bids to result in a multi-year contract with a qualified contractor to provide private water taxi or passenger charter boat service from a place on the Ketchikan road system to the Annette Bay Ferry Terminal on Annette Island. The awarded contractor will be required to transport five (5) AMHS employee crew members to and from the M/V Lituya docked at the AMHS Annette Bay Ferry Terminal Thursday through Monday twice a day. The morning route will depart at approximately 7:45AM. For the evening route, the AMHS crew members will need to be picked up at 5:15PM and returned to the Ketchikan road system where they departed from in the morning.

Copies of bid documents may be downloaded (Adobe Acrobat format) from this Online Public Notice website. If you download the solicitation, you must register with the Procurement Officer listed below to receive subsequent amendments. Failure to contact the Procurement Officer may result in the rejection of your offer.

Copies of the bid documents are also available upon request from the Procurement Officer.

Cherish Petrenchak

Voice: (907)465-8447

Fax: (907) 465-3124

Email: cherish.petrenchak@alaska.gov

category_id: Services: Transport, Logistics, Hauling, Shipping, Warehousing, Moving Bids
title: V112--Laundry Trucking Service Phoenix VA
description: THIS IS A SOURCES SOUGHT NOTICE (SSN) ISSUED SOLELY FOR INFORMATION AND PLANNING PURPOSES ONLY AND DOES NOT CONSTITUTE A SOLICITATION. DISCLAIMER This SSN is issued solely for information and planning purposes only and does not constitute a solicitation. All information received in response to this SSN that is marked as proprietary will be handled accordingly. IAW FAR 15.201(e), responses to this notice are not offers and cannot be accepted by the Government to form a binding contract. Responders are solely responsible for all expenses associated with responding to this SSN. SOURCES SOUGHT DESCRIPTION The purpose of this notice is to gain knowledge of potential qualified sources and their size classification relative to the North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code 484110 General Freight Trucking, Local. The small business size standard is $30.0M. Responses to this notice will be used by the Government to make appropriate acquisition decisions. After review of the responses to this notice, a solicitation announcement may be published. Responses to this notice are not considered adequate responses for a solicitation announcement. The Department of Veterans Affairs (VA), VISN 22 Network Contracting Office 22, is seeking capable sources that are classified and registered in www.vip.vetbiz.gov as either Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Businesses (SDVOSB) or Veteran-Owned Small Businesses (VOSB) that can provide transportation for supplies and laundry delivery services of clean and soiled linen items to/from the Phoenix Veterans Administration Health Care System (PVAHCS), Laundry Plant, Phoenix, AZ. and the Northern Arizona Veterans Administration Health Care System (NAVAHCS), Prescott AZ. and back again and surrounding Community Based Outpatient Clinics (CBOC s). The anticipated period of performance is a 12-months Base Period and four 12-months Option Periods. The information identified above is intended to be descriptive, not restrictive and to indicate the quality of the supplies/services that will be satisfactory. It is the responsibility of the interested source to demonstrate to the government that the interested parties can provide the supplies/services that fulfill the required specifications. Other interested and capable businesses of providing the services described in this notice, shall provide the information indicated below. Response to this notice should include business name, address, point of contact, size of business pursuant to the following questions: Identification of business size status, Cage Code, and SAM ID. Please indicate the size standard and representation of your business, such as but not limited to: Service-Disabled Veteran Owned Small Business (SDVOSB), Veteran Owned Small Business (VOSB), Hubzone, Woman Owned Small Business (WOSB), Large Business, etc.). Indication of which NAICS code(s) your business usually performs under Government contracts. Proof of experience and capability to provide the service indicated on this notice. If you intend to sub-contract any work, what portion of the total cost will be self-performed/will be performed by your organization? Please provide estimated detailed percentage breakdowns related to sub-contracted work and completion of job. Does your business have an FSS contract with GSA or the VA or are you a contract holder with NASA SEWP or any other federal contract? If so, please provide the contract number. If you are an FSS GSA/VA or NASA SEWP contract holder or other federal contract holder, are the services you are providing information for available on your schedule/contract? General pricing of your service is encouraged. Pricing will be used for the purpose of market research only. It will not be used to evaluate for any type of award. Please review the attached Performance Work Statement (PWS) and provide feedback or suggestions. If none, please reply as N/A. Responses to this notice shall be submitted via email to Ms. Tammy Perrine, Contracting Specialist, tammy.perrine@va.gov. Telephone responses will not be accepted. Responses must be received no later than 4:00 p.m. AZ time on 6 June 2022. If a solicitation is issued it shall be announced at a later date, and all interested parties must respond to that solicitation announcement separately from the responses to this notice. Responses to this notice are not a request to be added to a prospective bidders list or to receive a copy of the solicitation.

Please review the attached Performance Work Statement (PWS) and provide feedback or suggestions. If none, please reply as N/A. Responses to this notice shall be submitted via email to Ms. Tammy Perrine, Contracting Specialist, tammy.perrine@va.gov. Telephone responses will not be accepted. Responses must be received no later than 4:00 p.m. AZ time on 6 June 2022. If a solicitation is issued it shall be announced at a later date, and all interested parties must respond to that solicitation announcement separately from the responses to this notice. Responses to this notice are not a request to be added to a prospective bidders list or to receive a copy of the solicitation.

category_id: Services: Transport, Logistics, Hauling, Shipping, Warehousing, Moving Bids
title: RFP for As-Needed Moving Services
description:
The City of San Diego (City) is committed to providing its departments with moving services using professional, efficient, and experienced movers. The successful proposer (Contractor) shall provide office relocation and moving services on an as needed basis. Services may include, but are not limited to, moving free standing furniture, records and City-owned equipment throughout various locations in the City of San Diego. Services may consist of moving one or more individual offices and/or department from one physical location to another within the City. The Contractor shall also pick-up and deliver City-owned surplus property to the City's contracted auctioneer provided on an as-needed basis.

Taylor Cox 619-236-6044
CoxTJ@sandiego.gov

category_id: Services: Transport, Logistics, Hauling, Shipping, Warehousing, Moving Bids
title: Bids for Drayage Services
description: The County of Los Angeles (County) Department of Treasurer and Tax Collector (TTC) is issuing this Invitation for Bids (IFB) for the provision of Drayage Services. You may download the IFB from the Internet by accessing the County’s website at https://camisvr.co.la.ca.us/lacobids/, selecting “Open Solicitations,” and then searching by the solicitation title of Drayage Services. You may also download the IFB by accessing the TTC’s website at https://ttc.lacounty.gov/contract-opportunities. Potential Bidders are responsible for downloading and reviewing the entire IFB. The IFB contains the service requirements, bid content and format requirements, a description of the bid selection process, and a sample contract. Potential Bidders that meet the minimum requirements identified in Subparagraph 1.4, Bidder’s Minimum Mandatory Qualifications, are invited to submit a bid to provide the services described in Appendix B, Statement of Work. Potential Bidders should carefully review the IFB and ensure their bid complies with all IFB requirements. A virtual Mandatory Bidders’ Conference (Conference) to answer questions regarding the written specifications of the IFB will be held at 11:00 a.m. Pacific Time (PT) on Thursday, June 2, 2022. Bidders that intend to submit bids must attend this conference or will be disqualified. To register to attend the Conference, please send an email to Ashley Cupino, Contracts Section, at contracts@ttc.lacounty.gov no later than 5:00 p.m. PT on Tuesday, May 31, 2022. Bids must be prepared in accordance with Subparagraph 2.9, Bid Submission, of the IFB. Bidders understand and agree that submission of a bid constitutes acknowledgement and acceptance of, and a willingness to comply with, all terms and conditions of this IFB and any IFB addenda including, but not limited to, Appendix B, Statement of Work. The terms and conditions of the Sample Contract are not negotiable. Bids are due no later than 5:00 p.m. PT on Tuesday, June 21, 2022, and shall be submitted in accordance with Subparagraph 2.9 to: contracts@ttc.lacounty.gov. Bids received after the scheduled deadline will not be accepted and shall be returned to the sender unopened.

title: Subcontractors Needed: Trucker Broker
description:
A. Teichert & Son, Inc. dba Teichert Construc


An Equal Opportunity Employer,


is requesting quotations from all qualified


WBE,MBE


sub-contractors and material suppliers for the following project:



2021 Greenback Lane Complete Streets Improvements Project



City/Location: Citrus Heights, CA


County: Sacramento



Owner: City of Citrus Heights



Bid Date: Tuesday 12/20/2022 at 3:00 PM



We are requesting bids for the following trades and/or supplies:


Teichert Construction is requesting quotes from all qualified subcontractors and suppliers including certified MBE/WBE firms for the following items of work, including but not limited to: all materials, labor and equipment for CONSTRUCTION AREA SIGNS, TRAFFIC CONTROL SYSTEM, RESET, ADJUST ROADWAY ITEMS, PLANE ASPHALT CONCRETE, CLEARING & GRUBBING, EROSION CONTROL, AGGREGATE BASE, ASPHALT CONCRETE, PAVING ASPHALT (ASPHALT CONCRETE), PAVEMENT REINFORCING FABRIC, RECYCLE, RECLAIM ASPHALT CONCRETE, MINOR CONCRETE STRUCTURE, ALTERNATIVE PIPE CULVERT, REINFORCED CONCRETE PIPE, PLASTIC PIPE, CONCRETE CURB & SIDEWALK- MISC, SURVEY OR HISTORICAL MONUMENT, THERMOPLASTIC TRAFFIC STRIPING & MARKING, LAND SURVEYING, CUTTING, SAFETY EQUIPMENT SUPPLIER, PETROLEUM, OIL, LUBRICANTS SUPPLIER (BULK ITEM), ASPHALT SUPPLIER(BULK ITEM), PIPE SUPPLIER, DRAINAGE SYSTEMS SUPPLIER, STORM WATER SYSTEMS SUPPLIER, PAVEMENT MARKERS SUPPLIER, ELECTRICAL & SIGNALS SUPPLIER, TRAFFIC STRIPES, MARKING AND TRAFFIC CONTROL MATERIALS SUPPLIER, MATERIAL TESTING SERVICES, LAND SURVEYOR, LEAD COMPLIANCE, SWPPP PLANNING, BOTTOM DUMP TRUCK, TRANSFER DUMP TRUCK, SUPER 10 DUMP TRUCK, WATER TRUCK, END DUMP TRUCK, STREET SWEEPING TRUCK and TRUCKER BROKER.



NAICS Classifications
Sector 23--Construction
All Other Specialty Trade Contractors
Other Heavy and Civil Engineering Construction



CSI Classifications
DIVISION 1 - GENERAL
TRUCKING-HEAVY HAULING
TRUCKS -- DUMP/TRAILERS
DIVISION 2 - SITE WORK
CONCRETE CURBS/GUTTERS
CONCRETE PIPE
PAVING/SURFACING
SIGNAGE
TRAFFIC SIGNALS



Bid documents can be viewed at or obtained from:


Docs & Plans Available from https://www.citrusheightsplanroom.com/



Request for qualified bids from Subcontractors, Suppliers & Truckers for the following project:
Project: 2021 Greenback Lane Complete Streets Improvements Project ? City of Citrus Heights 

Docs & Plans Available from https://www.citrusheightsplanroom.com/
Estimate: $2,400,000 Duration: 90 working days Agency Goals: 16.1% MBE and 6.9% WBE 
Teichert Construction intends to work cooperatively with all qualified firms seeking work on this project, including but not limited to breaking out contract work items into economically feasible units to increase overall MBE/WBE participation. Plans and specifications are available from the municipality listed above and the Teichert?s Roseville Estimating office. For assistance obtaining or regarding the plans and specifications, please contact the listed Estimator.

100% Payment and Performance Bonds for subcontractors are required. Teichert will pay bond premium up to 2%. Insurance Waiver of subrogation also required. However, certified MBE/WBE's are encouraged to contact Teichert and request assistance if they are unable to meet Teichert's standard bonding or insurance requirements. MBE/WBE's also are encouraged to contact Teichert for assistance in obtaining lines of credit, equipment, supplies, materials or related assistance or services. Subcontractor, Supplier and Trucker quotes must be valid, at minimum, for the award period stated in the contract documents. Please note that this is a prevailing wage project and Teichert Construction is Union signatory. Subcontractors will be subject to the terms and conditions of Teichert's subcontract and safety documents available at www.teichert.com/for-subcontractors.cfm. Submission of a bid to Teichert will confirm that you have reviewed and accepted Teichert's subcontract form. Conditions or exceptions in Subcontractor?s quote are expressly rejected unless accepted in writing prior to bid. Subcontractor scopes and supplier quotes are required 24 hours prior to bid. Additional information and or assistance to MBE/WBE's available from: *** All Subcontractor Quotes must have the Department of Industrial Relations # to be ACCEPTED ***




A. Teichert & Son, Inc. dba Teichert Construc


400 Sunrise Avenue, Suite 300


Roseville, CA 95661


Phone: (916) 757-6400  Fax: (916) 757-6499


John Gale


estimating@teichert.com

description: USTRANSCOM is seeking sources that possess the availability and capability to provide Stevedoring and Related Terminal Services (S&RTS) at the port of Poti, Georgia in connection with the import and export of Defense Transportation System (DTS) sponsored cargo.? Services will cover the full spectrum of handling surface moving cargo, to include its receipt through disposition, and processing cargo for simultaneous shipments via multiple surface modes of transportation as designated by the Contracting Officer (CO) or their appointed Contracting Officer?s Representative (COR) and Alternate Contracting Officer?s Representative (ACOR). ?The contractor may be required to perform services 24 hours per day, seven (7) days per week, 365 days per year to include all official holidays. ?If the Government notifies the Contractor that the employment or the continued employment of any Contractor employee is prejudicial to the interests or endangers the security of the United States of America, the Contractor shall make any changes necessary in the appointment(s). ?

title: Grade A 40' Storage Containers
description: This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with the format in Subpart 12.6, as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. This announcement constitutes the only solicitation; quotes are being requested and a written solicitation will not be issued. This solicitation is issued as a Request for Quotation (RFQ). The solicitation and incorporated provisions and clauses are those in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular 2021-05. The U.S. Consumer Product Safety Commission (CPSC) intends to procure 2 grade A 40' standard height storage containers, painted white with lock boxes installed. The 40' standard height storage containers must be provided on a Firm-Fixed basis. The provision at 52.212-1, Instructions to Offerors-Commercial Items (Nov 2021), applies to this acquisition. In addition to the requirements of FAR 52.212-1, the quote must prominently display the offeror's Taxpayer Identification number, CAGE code and DUNS number, as well as contact information for the offeror's point of contact for the quote. A valid SAM.gov registration is required for award.? The clause at 52.212-4, Contract Terms and Conditions-Commercial Items (Nov 2021), applies to this acquisition. Please see attachment for the remaining clauses and provisions. Evaluation of quotes will be on a lowest priced technically acceptable basis. Technical acceptability will be determined by quoting all required items at a fair and reasonable price. Questions on this requirement are due no later than May 27, 2022 at 12:00pm Eastern. Quotes are due via email to DBraswell@cpsc.gov no later than June 6, 2022 at 12:00pm Eastern. ?

title: Government Owned Contractor Operated Alongside Aircraft Refueling Services
description: ****AMENDMENT 0006 is hereby issued to EXTEND the solicitation DUE TO A CHANGE WITHIN THE REQUIREMENT.? PLEASE ENSURE YOU READ AND LOOK AT ALL UPDATES AND CHANGES!!!!? Attached you will find the Amendment, an? updated Solicitation and Performance Work Statement which provides all CHANGES. ********? *Amendment 0005 is hereby issued to EXTEND the solicitation close date and to provide a solicitation update that incorporates three new clauses. *Amendment 0004 is hereby issued to EXTEND the solicitation close date.?? *Amendment 0003 is hereby issued to provide a clean copy of the Performance Work Statement. *Amendment 0002 is hereby issued to provide an updated Past Performance Questionnaire (PPQ) with the correct name in the RETURN INFORMATION SECTION of the document. *Amendment 0001 is hereby provided to update section L-0002 L198 PREPROPOSAL CONFERENCE (SERVICES) (DLA ENERGY JUL 2018) of the solicitation, and to inform offerors of change in date for when all questions are due for submittal. Solicitation close date is extended to April 25, 2022.* *Please read entire modification.? In reference to the attendance to the conference ensure that you submit your information by the date stated.? Thanks!* Defense Logistics Agency - Energy is issuing a Request for Proposal (RFP) for Alongside Aircraft Refueling Services to include managing, maintaining, and operating Government Owned Fuel Service Facilities and equipment at the Government Owned, Contractor-Operated (GOCO) facilities at Naval Air Station Patuxent River (NAS Patuxent River), MD. Services include providing all technical support, personnel, supervision, equipment, tools, materials, and other items as required by the Performance Work Statement (PWS) on behalf of DLA Energy, in support of the Department of Navy. The vendor will be responsible to furnish, manage, maintain, and operate mobile fuel servicing equipment required to support the facilities, equipment, vehicles, and aircraft assigned to and as may transit, deploy to, or exercise at this location. The vendor will also be responsible to provide, maintain, and operate Contractor-Furnished Vehicles in support of aircraft and vehicles assigned or transient to NAS Patuxent River. DLA Energy will follow source selection procedures utilizing the Lowest Price Technically Acceptable (LPTA) evaluation process in accordance with FAR 15.101-2 for this acquisition. The requirement is a four-year base performance period from Jan 1, 2023 - Dec 31, 2026; five-year option period from Jan 1, 2027 - Dec 31, 2031, and option to extend the contract for a total of no more than six months (anticipated Jan 1, 2032 - Jun 30, 2032). Solicitation number will be SPE603-22-R-0504. The pre-proposal conference location and date is to be determined. Notice of this conference will be posted via Amendment at a later date.? This acquisition will be Full and Open Competition (unrestricted). DLA Energy will award one Firm-Fixed Price contract. Contract awarded will be subject to FAR 52.222-41, Service Contract Act of 1965. The North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) Code is 493190, and the size standard is $30 million.All responsible offerors may submit an offer for consideration. Secure Documents Several documents related to this solicitation will be posted as "secured" in the www.Sam.gov website. Please find below instructions to access secured documents in www.Sam.gov. Instructions for access to the www.Sam.gov Secure Site: To access the secured, but unclassified, documents in the SAM.gov ("www.Sam.gov ") system, offerors must: Several documents related to this solicitation will be posted as "secured" in the https://sam.gov/ (Contract Opportunities). Please find below instructions to access secured documents in https:/sam.gov/ (Contract Opportunities). Instructions for access to the https://sam.gov/ (Contract Opportunities): To access the secured, but unclassified, documents in https://sam.gov/ (Contract Opportunities), offerors must: 1. Be registered in the System for Award Management (SAM). Please note that SAM has replaced the previous system Central Contractor Registration (CCR). If an entity was previously registered in CRR the information should have transferred into SAM. You just need to set up a SAM account and migrate your CCR roles. 2. Once registered in SAM, go to website at https://sam.gov/ (Contract Opportunities) and log in. Verify your registration within the SAM system. The https://beta.sam.gov/ learning guide is available at https://sam.gov/help/new-to-sam to provide assistance. NOTE:? PLEASE KEEP IN MIND ALL DATES ARE SUBJECT TO CHANGE!!!

category_id: Infrastructure: Patching, Milling, Seal Coat, Asphalt Repair Bids
title: Bids for Maintenance for the East Bay Greenway
buyer: Alameda County Congestion Management Agency, California
agency: Alameda County Congestion Management Agency, California
description:
Maintenance for the East Bay Greenway Between the Coliseum BART Station and 85th Ave (Segment 7A) (R22-0012)

The Alameda County Transportation Commission (Alameda CTC) proposes seeking bids from contractors to maintain the East Bay Greenway (Segment 7A) along San Leandro Street between the Coliseum BART Station and 85th Avenue (Project). The Project includes sweeping, weed removal, graffiti removal, striping, pothole filling, painting of fences/railing, repair/replacement of railing and other items as described in the contract documents. A California Class A contractor’s license is required.
This contract will be funded with Measure B funds. As such, the Alameda CTC Local Business Contract Equity Program (LBCE) will apply. The LBCE Program’s goals for construction are 60.0% for Local Business Enterprise (LBE) and 20.0% for Small Local Business Enterprise (SLBE). This contract is not subject to the Disadvantaged Business Enterprise Program.

title: Facility Asphalt Repair and Overlay Project
description:
Bid Number: 	SRWWTP 2022-002
Bid Title: 	Facility Asphalt Repair & Overlay Project
Category: 	Snake River WWTP
Status: 	Open

Description:

Summit County Snake River WWTP

Request for Proposals

Facility Asphalt Repair & Overlay Project



The Snake River Wastewater Treatment Plant, an Enterprise Fund of Summit County Government, is currently soliciting proposals to provide its treatment facility driveway and parking lot areas with asphalt repair and overlay of approximately 90,000 square feet.   A full Request for Proposals and description of the work to be provided can be obtained at www.co.summit.co.us/Bids.aspx. Submit questions regarding the proposals to  josh.johnson@summitcountyco.gov.



All bids must be titled “2022 Asphalt Repair & Overlay Proposal” and shall be electronically submitted to josh.johnson@summitcountyco.gov and kirsten.norman@summitcountyco.gov or by a sealed, hardcopy delivery mailed to the attention of Josh Johnson at: Snake River WWTP 4344 Swan Mountain Road Dillon, CO 80435 by 2:00 pm Thursday June 23, 2022.  Proposals received after 2:00pm, will NOT be accepted.  



At said time and place, all accepted proposals that have been duly received will be publicly opened and read aloud. The Contract will be awarded to the lowest responsible bidder who best meets the requirements of Summit County and the public interest.



Summit County Board of County Commissioners reserves the right to reject any or all proposals, to waive irregularities or informalities, and to conduct such investigations or negotiations as it deems necessary to select the most responsible and responsive proposal.
Publication Date/Time:
5/20/2022 6:00 AM
Closing Date/Time:
6/23/2022 2:00 PM

category_id: Infrastructure: Patching, Milling, Seal Coat, Asphalt Repair Bids
title: Street Cut Repair Program
description:
Street Cut Repair Program

The work to be done under this contract consists of furnishing all labor, materials, and equipment necessary to remove and replace existing pavements on streets, sidewalks, driveways, and the like in the City of Carbondale. All work shall be in accordance with the contract documents, plans, specifications, and as directed by the Engineer or his representative.

Bids will be received until 10:00 a.m., Thursday, June 9, 2022, by mail or delivered by hand to the Finance Department Purchasing Office, City of Carbondale, 200 South Illinois Avenue, Carbondale, Illinois, immediately after which time and at such place all bids will be publicly opened and read aloud.

The Project is also subject to the State of Illinois Job Works Jobs Program Act and the Illinois Works Apprentice Initiative.

Contractor shall not pay less than the prevailing rates of wages to all laborers, workmen, and mechanics performing work under this contract, and shall comply with the requirements of the Illinois Wages of Employees on Public Works Act (820ILCS 130/1-12).

No bid shall be withdrawn for a period of forty-five (45) days subsequent to the opening of bids without consent of the City of Carbondale.

The Contract shall be awarded to the lowest responsible bidder complying with the provisions of this Invitation for Bids. The owner reserves the right to reject any or all proposals and to waive any informality or technicality in any proposal in the interest of the City.

category_id: Infrastructure: Patching, Milling, Seal Coat, Asphalt Repair Bids
title: Road Milling and Resurfacing
description:
OWNER - The Town of Medaryville acting through its Board, hereby gives notice that sealed bids will be received at the Medaryville Town Hall for the following described project.

PROJECT This project generally consists of the milling and resurfacing of the road surface of Main, Boston, West Maple and West Streets in the Town of Medaryville, Pulaski County Indiana.

Bids will be received on the following contract(s):

M0068-05-22-00111.00 - Contract A - Main, Boston, West Maple, & West Street Pavement Improvements

TIME Sealed bids will be received until 11:00 AM local time, on Wednesday, June 8, 2022 in the Medaryville Town Hall, 409 E. Main, Medaryville, IN 47957. Bids will be opened at this time.

BIDS All bids shall be addressed to Town of Medaryville, 409 E. Main Street, Medaryville, IN 47957.

Bids shall be sealed and shall have the name and address of the bidder and the contract for which the bid is being submitted on the outside of the envelope. All bidders shall bid in accordance with and upon the Bid Forms included in the contract documents.

EXAMINATION OF CONTRACT DOCUMENTS The contract documents are on file for inspection at the office of McMAHON Associates, Inc., 952 S. State Road 2, Valparaiso, IN 46385.

PROCUREMENT OF CONTRACT DOCUMENTS Copies of the contract documents may be obtained from McMAHON Associates, Inc., 952 S. State Road 2, Valparaiso, Indiana 46385, phone number: 219-462-7743, email: bkwolf@mcmgrp-in.com.

A non-refundable processing charge of $50.00 will be required for each set of contract documents. The fee applies whether digital or paper documents are obtained, or if the plans and picked up or shipped to Contractor.

BID SECURITY No bid shall be received unless accompanied by a certified check or satisfactory bid bond payable to Town of Medaryville in the in an amount not less than 5% of the maximum bid as a guarantee that, if the bid is accepted, the bidder will execute and file the contract, performance/payment bonds and insurance certification, as required by the contract documents, within ten (10) days after the Notice of Award.

BID REJECTION The OWNER reserves the right to reject any and all bids, waive any informalities in bidding or to accept the bid or bids which best serves the interests of the Town of Medaryville.

WITHDRAWAL OF BIDS No bid shall be withdrawn for a period of 60-days after the scheduled opening without the consent of the OWNER.

GOVERNING LAWS & REGULATIONS The contract letting shall be subject to and governed by the laws of the State of Indiana.

Published by the authority of the Town of Medaryville acting through its Board.

Ms. Stacy Conley, Clerk-Treasurer

description:
The County Commissioners of Caroline County, on behalf of the Caroline County Department of Public Works, are accepting proposals for a County-Wide Paving and Patching Contract to be conducted on various roads throughout the County, as directed by the Director of Public Works.   Work is generally described as follows:

The work is anticipated to total approximately $1.5 Million.
Scope is to widen existing pavement by a minimum of 4 ft along roadway segments and at intersection radii and provide full depth HMA section for widened areas.
Provide full depth roadway patching.
Contracts may be awarded to multiple bidders.

title: Local Area Set-Aside (FAR 26.2): Office Furniture Move - Austin Texas FEMA TRO
description: The Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) Region 6 Texas Recovery Office in Austin, Texas is relocating its office within the vicinity of? its current office in Austin, TX (within 15 miles of current location) and requires the service of office furniture movers to palletize, load, transport and unload office furniture and items.?Some items require minor assembly at destination such as desks.? Some items are prepalletized and some require palletization.? Details are in the Statement of Work (SOW).? The Item List attached to the SOW indicates if items require assembly and/or require palletization.? Pictures of most, but not all of the items are also included with the SOW.?? FEMA is requesting a quotation from local area vendors to provide furniture moving service who reside or primarily do business in the Presidentially Declared Disaster Area of DR-4332-TX Hurricane Harvey. The declared disaster counties are listed in the solicitation.?? Site Visit:? November 10, 2021 11:00 a.m. Central Time RSVP to Patricia.Gilmore@fema.dhs.gov - All pariticipants must comply with EO 14042 Ensuring Adequate COVID Safety Protocols for Federal Contractors - A list of attendee full names shall be provided 72 hours in advance.? title: Total Small Business Set-Aside (FAR 19.5): Miller's Flat Gravel Haul-Manti-LaSal National Forest
description: The Manti-LaSal National Forest anticipates a need for loading and hauling of up to 20,000 CY of stockpiled aggregate on the Millers Flat Road 50014 The project consists of: This contract is for the loading and hauling of up to 20,000 CY of stockpiled aggregate on to the Millers flat road 50014. The material for the northern portion of the road, from Highway 31 to the intersection of 53306 at the Scad Valley Divide, will come from the Cabin Hollow Pit. The material for the southern portion of the road, From the intersection of 53306 at Scad Valley Divide to the intersection with 50217 Potters Canyon, will come from the Reederview Pit. This contract also includes options. Option 1:? The loading and hauling of up to 3,200 CY of stockpiled aggregate on to the main roads in the Lake Fork Canyon Campground. This includes roads Lake Canyon 50359, Lake Canyon South Access 53132, Lake Canyon CG New Loop 53133, Lake Canyon Rolfson South 53050 and Lake Canyon Rolfson North 53051 from the Cabin Hollow Pit. Option 2:? The loading and hauling of up to 1,500 CY of stockpiled aggregate on to the Potters Canyon Road 50271 and the South Loop of Potters Campground 52217 from the Reederview Pit. Option 3:? The loading and hauling of up to 6,000 CY of stockpiled aggregate on to the South Skyline Drive Road from Highway 31 to the end of the gravel, approximately 7 miles. Option 4:? The loading and hauling of up to 3,000 CY of stockpiled aggregate onto North Skyline from Highway 31 to the pit location. This will occur at locations if they begin to show excess wear from hauling operations. Option 5:? The loading and hauling of up to 3,000 CY of stockpiled aggregate onto the South end of Millers Flat from the pit location to the intersection with Potters Canyon 50271. This will occur at locations if they begin to show excess wear from hauling operations. The contract includes loading stockpiled aggregate into hauling vehicles and dumping onto roadway to be spread and placed by the forest service. Minimum of 6 hauling trucks will be required at all times during hauling days. Hauling days will be Monday ? Friday 8am ? 5pm, except on Holiday Weekends. The project location is: The Cabin Hollow Pit is located approximately 15 miles northeast of Fairview, Utah. You can access the Cabin Hollow Pit from Fairview by traveling east on Highway 31 up Fairview Canyon to the intersection with Forest road 50150 Skyline drive, then North approximately 5 miles on 50150 Skyline Drive to the pit. The Reederview Pit is located approximately 17 miles northwest of Orangeville, Utah. You can access the Reeder View Pit from Orangeville by traveling west on Highway 29 up Straight Canyon to the intersection with Forest road 50014 Miller Flat Rd, then North approximately 0.7 miles on 50014 Miller Flat Rd to the pit. The Millers Flat road 50014 is located approximately 19 miles northeast of Fairview, Utah, traveling east on Highway 31. This road is the main location for the delivery of the aggregate. From this intersection the project extends south along the Millers Flat road approximately 11 miles. Options 1, 2 & 5 are accessed from this section of roadway. The South Skyline Road 50150 is located approximately 14 miles northeast of Fairview, Utah, traveling east on Highway 31. From this intersection this option of the project extends south along the South Skyline road approximately 7 miles. Questions regarding this opportunity are due in writing to the CO, Chris Hansen, christine.m.hansen@usda.gov? by Tuesday, May 31, 2022 at 1:00 PM Mountain Time (local time). Project start date will be approximately May 1, 2023 This project is a total Small Business Set Aside. All future information about this acquisition, including amendments, will be distributed solely through this site. Interested parties are responsible for monitoring this site to ensure that they have the most up-to-date information about this acquisition. SAM REGISTRATION REQUIREMENTS: Prospective contractors must be registered in the System for Award Management (SAM) prior to submitting a proposal www.sam.gov.

title: Government Owned Contractor Operated Alongside Aircraft Refueling Services
description: Amendment 0002-Preproposal Conference Sign-In Sheets and Preproposal Conference Presentations Dated: May 25, 2022 Amendment 0001- Updated PWS Dated: May 5, 2022 Defense Logistics Agency - Energy is issuing a Request for Proposal (RFP) for Alongside Aircraft Refueling Services to include managing, maintaining, and operating Government Owned Fuel Service Facilities and equipment at the Government Owned, Contractor-Operated (GOCO) facilities at Naval Air Station Souda Bay (NAS Souda Bay), Greece. ?Services include providing all technical support, personnel, supervision, equipment, tools, materials, and other items as required by the Performance Work Statement (PWS) on behalf of DLA Energy, in support of the Department of Navy. The vendor will be responsible to furnish, manage, maintain, and operate mobile fuel servicing equipment required to support the facilities, equipment, vehicles, and aircraft assigned to and as may transit, deploy to, or exercise at this location. The vendor will also be responsible to provide, maintain, and operate Contractor-Furnished Vehicles in support of aircraft and vehicles assigned or transient to NAS Souda Bay, Greece. DLA Energy will follow source selection procedures utilizing the Lowest Price Technically Acceptable (LPTA) evaluation process in accordance with FAR 15.101-2 for this acquisition. The requirement is a four-year base performance period from Dec 1, 2023 - Nov 30, 2027; five-year option period from Dec 1, 2027 - Nov 30, 2032, and option to extend the contract for a total of no more than six months (anticipated Dec 1, 2032 - May 31, 2033). Solicitation number will be SPE603-22-R-0506. The pre-proposal conference will be held on Wednesday, May 18, 2022 commencing at 8:30 AM at: Naval Support Activity Souda Bay Greece Visitor Control Center (VCC) Mouzouras Rd., BLDG 85 American Base Chania, Crete, Greece 73100 All attendees must provide by email to the Contract Specialist, Wing Yi Wong, at wing.wong@dla.mil, on or before 3p.m. (US Eastern Time), April 28, 2022, the name(s) and company represented, of the individual(s) who plan to attend. In addition, foreign nationals must provide a copy of their passport ID (including the bio-data page) and a copy of company travel order. U.S. citizens must provide a copy of their U.S. passport (including the bio-data page) and a copy of company travel order. U.S. DOD Civilians and contractors must provide a copy of their DOD ID (front and back) and a copy of company travel order. *For Foreign Nationals, the processing time will take up to 3 weeks. This acquisition will be Full and Open Competition (unrestricted). DLA Energy will award one Firm-Fixed Price contract. Contract awarded will be subject to FAR 52.222-41, Service Contract Act of 1965. The North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) Code is 493190, and the size standard is $30 million.? All responsible offerors may submit an offer for consideration. Secure Documents Several documents related to this solicitation will be posted as "secured" in the www.Sam.gov website. Please find below instructions to access secured documents in www.Sam.gov. Instructions for access to the www.Sam.gov Secure Site: To access the secured, but unclassified, documents in the SAM.gov ("www.Sam.gov ") system, offerors must: Several documents related to this solicitation will be posted as "secured" in the https://sam.gov/ (Contract Opportunities). Please find below instructions to access secured documents in https:/sam.gov/ (Contract Opportunities). Instructions for access to the https://sam.gov/ (Contract Opportunities): To access the secured, but unclassified, documents in https://sam.gov/ (Contract Opportunities), offerors must: 1. Be registered in the System for Award Management (SAM). Please note that SAM has replaced the previous system Central Contractor Registration (CCR). If an entity was previously registered in CRR the information should have transferred into SAM. You just need to set up a SAM account and migrate your CCR roles. 2. Once registered in SAM, go to website at https://sam.gov/ (Contract Opportunities) and log in. Verify your registration within the SAM system. The https://beta.sam.gov/ learning guide is available at https://sam.gov/help/new-to-sam to provide assistance. NOTE:? PLEASE KEEP IN MIND ALL DATES ARE SUBJECT TO CHANGE!!!

Questions must be submitted by using the 'Submit a Question' feature at https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com. Questions not received within a reasonable time prior to close of the solicitation may not be considered.*** For this solicitation, MICC Fort Lee intends to conduct an online competitive reverse auction to be facilitated by the third-party reverse auction provider, Unison Marketplace. Unison Marketplace has developed an online, anonymous, browser based application to conduct the reverse auction. An Offeror may submit a series of pricing bids, which descend in price during the specified period of time for the aforementioned reverse auction. MICC Fort Lee is taking this action in an effort to improve both vendor access and awareness of requests and the agency's ability to gather multiple, competed, real-time bids. All responsible Offerors that respond to this solicitation MUST submit the pricing portion of their bid using the online exchange located at https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com. There is no cost to register, review procurement data or make a bid on https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com. Offerors that are not currently registered to use https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com should proceed to https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com to complete their free registration. Offerors that require special considerations or assistance may contact Marketplace Support at 1.877.933.3243 or via email at marketplacesupport@unisonglobal.com. Offerors may not artificially manipulate the price of a transaction on https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com by any means. It is unacceptable to place bad faith bids, to use decoys in the https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com process or to collude with the intent or effect of hampering the competitive https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com process. Should offerors require additional clarification, notify the point of contact or Marketplace Support at 1.877.933.3243 or marketplacesupport@unisonglobal.com.Use of Unison Marketplace: Buyers and Sellers agree to conduct this transaction through Unison Marketplace in compliance with the Unison Marketplace Terms of Use. Failure to comply with the below terms and conditions may result in offer being determined as non-responsive. 7 June 2022 AT 10:30AM ET. site visit POC email magno.g.orellanaalavarado.civ@army.mil. Last date to submit site visit names is 3 June 2022. New Equipment, Parts ONLY; NO remanufactured or "gray market" items. All items must be covered by the manufacturer's warranty. Bid MUST be good for 60 calendar days after close of Buy. Shipping must be free on board (FOB) destination CONUS (Continental U.S.), which means that the seller must deliver the goods on its conveyance at the destination specified by the buyer, and the seller is responsible for the cost of shipping and risk of loss prior to actual delivery at the specified destination. This solicitation requires registration with the System for Award Management (SAM) at the time an offer or quotation is submitted, excluding the exceptions outlined in FAR 4.1102(a). Registration information can be found at www.sam.gov. Failure to register in SAM may preclude an award being made to your company. The selected Offeror must comply with the following commercial item terms and conditions, which are incorporated herein by reference: FAR 52.212-1, Instructions to Offerors - Commercial Items, applies to this acquisition; FAR 52.212-3, Offeror Representations and Certifications - Commercial Items - the selected offeror must submit a completed copy of the listed representations and certifications; FAR 52.212-4, Contract Terms and Conditions - Commercial Items; FAR 52.212-5, Contract Terms and Conditions Required To Implement Statutes or Executive Orders-Commercial Items, paragraph (a) and the following clauses in paragraph (b): 52.222-21, 52.222-26, 52.222-35, 52.222-36, 52.222-37, 52.225-13, 52.232-34, 52.217-8, 52.217-9;52.246-1 Contractor Inspection Requirements; 252.225-7974 (Dev) Representation Regarding Business Operations with the Maduro Regime (DEVIATION 2020-O0005); 52.204-24 Representation Regarding Certain Telecommunications and Video Surveillance Services or Equipment DEC 2021;52.204-25 Prohibition on Contracting for Certain Telecommunications and Video Surveillance Services or Equipment DEC 2021; 252.204-7012 Safeguarding Covered Defense Information and Cyber Incident Reporting; 252.204-7015 Notice of Authorized Disclosure of Information for Litigation Support; 252.204-7016 Covered Defense Telecommunications Equipment or Services Representation; 252.204-7017 Prohibition on the Acquisition of Covered Defense Telecommunications Equipment or Services -- Representation; 252.204-7018 Prohibition on the Acquisition of Covered Defense Telecommunications Equipment or Services; See attachment 52.212-2 Evaluation--Commercial Items of terms and conditions Basis for Award: The Government will award to the lowest technically acceptable priced, responsible quote whose quote conforms to the requirement of the solicitation and most advantageous to the Government, price and other factors considered. Award will be made to the vendor that has the necessary licenses to perform work in Fort Lee, VA, meets or exceeds the acceptability standards for past performance, and proposes the lowest evaluated price. Government intends to make the award without discussions; however, reserves the right to hold discussion if required. See attached 52.212-1 and 2 for more information.

category_id: Services: Transport, Logistics, Hauling, Shipping, Warehousing, Moving Bids
title: Sludge Hauling Services
description:
REBID IFB 2022-042 Sludge Hauling Services

Status: Open
RFP 2801-1

City of Lynchburg -Lynchburg, VA

 Any and all addenda will ONLY be posted on the City's website at: http://www.lynchburgva.gov/current-solicitations

The purpose of this IFB (Invitation to Bid) is to supply the needs of the WRRF for drivers and trucks to haul sludge, process residuals and perform other related driver functions around the facility. At the time of this bid, material is disposed of at two locations: the Region 2000 Landfill on Livestock Road (Route A and emergency Route B) and the Maplewood Landfill in Amelia (Route C). The Plant’s materials must be hauled on the routes attached (Attachment A- Route Maps A-C) which are approved by the DEQ (Department of Environmental Quality). Use of any other routes unless routes are approved/established detours by Virginia Department of Transportation (VDOT), Virginia State Police (VSP) or other official state agency, are not allowed. Process residuals must be removed from the plant on a regular schedule.

The solicitation document and incorporated provisions and clauses are those in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular 2022-06. The associated North American Industrial Classification System (NAICS) code for this procurement is 488210 with a small business size standard of $15.00M. This requirement is a Small Business Set-Aside and only qualified offerors may submit bids. The solicitation pricing on https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com will start on the date this solicitation is posted, and, unless otherwise displayed at https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com, will end on: 2022-06-15 13:30:00.0 Eastern Time. This time supersedes the Offers Due Time listed above. FOB Destination shall be , null null The MICC Fort Lee requires the following items, Meet or Exceed, to the following: Base Period of Performance: 08/30/2022 - 08/31/2023 LI 001: Base Year- Maintenance and Repair Support Labor In accordance with the PWS, 1, job; LI 002: Base Year- Part/supplies/material/Equipment ensure that all replacement parts provided under this agreement are new and from the same manufacturer as the original part(s) or an equivalent that meets or exceeds OEM (Original Equipment Manufacturer) standards. All replacement parts shall have a minimum of a one (1) year warranty. Parts exceeding$ 500, for any one part shall not be purchased without prior approval of the COR. Approval may be obtainable telephonically, but shall be confirmed in writing within 5 working days. Any purchase in excess of $500 without the prior approval of the COR is done so at the sole risk of the Contractor. A ceiling of $15,000.00 per Year, for parts has been established. The Contractor shall not expend funds nor seek reimbursement in excess of $15,000.00 per year. Any expenditure in excess of $15,000.00 is done so at the sole risk of the Contractor., 1, job; Option 1 Period of Performance: 08/30/2023 - 08/31/2024 LI 001: Option Year 1- Maintenance and Repair Support Labor In accordance with the PWS, 1, job; LI 002: Option Year 1- Base Year- Part/supplies/material/Equipment ensure that all replacement parts provided under this agreement are new and from the same manufacturer as the original part(s) or an equivalent that meets or exceeds OEM (Original Equipment Manufacturer) standards. The Contractor shall not expend funds nor seek reimbursement in excess of $15,000.00 per year. Any expenditure in excess of $15,000.00 is done so at the sole risk of the Contractor., 1, job; Solicitation and Buy Attachments ***Question Submission: Interested offerors must submit any questions concerning the solicitation at the earliest time possible to enable the Buyer to respond. Questions must be submitted by using the 'Submit a Question' feature at https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com. Questions not received within a reasonable time prior to close of the solicitation may not be considered.*** For this solicitation, MICC Fort Lee intends to conduct an online competitive reverse auction to be facilitated by the third-party reverse auction provider, Unison Marketplace. Unison Marketplace has developed an online, anonymous, browser based application to conduct the reverse auction. An Offeror may submit a series of pricing bids, which descend in price during the specified period of time for the aforementioned reverse auction. MICC Fort Lee is taking this action in an effort to improve both vendor access and awareness of requests and the agency's ability to gather multiple, competed, real-time bids. All responsible Offerors that respond to this solicitation MUST submit the pricing portion of their bid using the online exchange located at https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com. There is no cost to register, review procurement data or make a bid on https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com. Offerors that are not currently registered to use https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com should proceed to https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com to complete their free registration. Offerors that require special considerations or assistance may contact Marketplace Support at 1.877.933.3243 or via email at marketplacesupport@unisonglobal.com. Offerors may not artificially manipulate the price of a transaction on https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com by any means. It is unacceptable to place bad faith bids, to use decoys in the https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com process or to collude with the intent or effect of hampering the competitive https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com process. Should offerors require additional clarification, notify the point of contact or Marketplace Support at 1.877.933.3243 or marketplacesupport@unisonglobal.com.Use of Unison Marketplace: Buyers and Sellers agree to conduct this transaction through Unison Marketplace in compliance with the Unison Marketplace Terms of Use. Failure to comply with the below terms and conditions may result in offer being determined as non-responsive. New Equipment, Parts ONLY; NO remanufactured or "gray market" items. All items must be covered by the manufacturer's warranty. Bid MUST be good for 60 calendar days after close of Buy. Shipping must be free on board (FOB) destination CONUS (Continental U.S.), which means that the seller must deliver the goods on its conveyance at the destination specified by the buyer, and the seller is responsible for the cost of shipping and risk of loss prior to actual delivery at the specified destination. This solicitation requires registration with the System for Award Management (SAM) at the time an offer or quotation is submitted, excluding the exceptions outlined in FAR 4.1102(a). Registration information can be found at www.sam.gov. Failure to register in SAM may preclude an award being made to your company. The selected Offeror must comply with the following commercial item terms and conditions, which are incorporated herein by reference: FAR 52.212-1, Instructions to Offerors - Commercial Items, applies to this acquisition; FAR 52.212-3, Offeror Representations and Certifications - Commercial Items - the selected offeror must submit a completed copy of the listed representations and certifications; FAR 52.212-4, Contract Terms and Conditions - Commercial Items; FAR 52.212-5, Contract Terms and Conditions Required To Implement Statutes or Executive Orders-Commercial Items, paragraph (a) and the following clauses in paragraph (b): 52.222-21, 52.222-26, 52.222-35, 52.222-36, 52.222-37, 52.225-13, 52.232-34, 52.217-8, 52.217-9;52.246-1 Contractor Inspection Requirements; 252.225-7974 (Dev) Representation Regarding Business Operations with the Maduro Regime (DEVIATION 2020-O0005); 52.204-24 Representation Regarding Certain Telecommunications and Video Surveillance Services or Equipment DEC 2021;52.204-25 Prohibition on Contracting for Certain Telecommunications and Video Surveillance Services or Equipment DEC 2021; 252.204-7012 Safeguarding Covered Defense Information and Cyber Incident Reporting; 252.204-7015 Notice of Authorized Disclosure of Information for Litigation Support; 252.204-7016 Covered Defense Telecommunications Equipment or Services Representation; 252.204-7017 Prohibition on the Acquisition of Covered Defense Telecommunications Equipment or Services -- Representation; 252.204-7018 Prohibition on the Acquisition of Covered Defense Telecommunications Equipment or Services; See attachment 52.212-2 Evaluation--Commercial Items of terms and conditions Basis for Award: The Government will award to the lowest technically acceptable priced, responsible quote whose quote conforms to the requirement of the solicitation and most advantageous to the Government, price and other factors considered. Award will be made to the vendor that has the necessary licenses to perform work in Fort Lee, VA, meets or exceeds the acceptability standards for past performance, and proposes the lowest evaluated price. Government intends to make the award without discussions; however, reserves the right to hold discussion if required. See attached 52.212-1 and 2 for more information. 23 May 2022 AT 10:30AM ET. site visit POC email magno.g.orellanaalavarado.civ@army.mil. Last date to submit site visit names is 20 May 2022.

title: Government Owned Contractor Operated Alongside Aircraft Refueling Services
description: Amendment 0001- Updated PWS Dated: May 5, 2022 Defense Logistics Agency - Energy is issuing a Request for Proposal (RFP) for Alongside Aircraft Refueling Services to include managing, maintaining, and operating Government Owned Fuel Service Facilities and equipment at the Government Owned, Contractor-Operated (GOCO) facilities at Naval Air Station Souda Bay (NAS Souda Bay), Greece. ?Services include providing all technical support, personnel, supervision, equipment, tools, materials, and other items as required by the Performance Work Statement (PWS) on behalf of DLA Energy, in support of the Department of Navy. The vendor will be responsible to furnish, manage, maintain, and operate mobile fuel servicing equipment required to support the facilities, equipment, vehicles, and aircraft assigned to and as may transit, deploy to, or exercise at this location. The vendor will also be responsible to provide, maintain, and operate Contractor-Furnished Vehicles in support of aircraft and vehicles assigned or transient to NAS Souda Bay, Greece. DLA Energy will follow source selection procedures utilizing the Lowest Price Technically Acceptable (LPTA) evaluation process in accordance with FAR 15.101-2 for this acquisition. The requirement is a four-year base performance period from Dec 1, 2023 - Nov 30, 2027; five-year option period from Dec 1, 2027 - Nov 30, 2032, and option to extend the contract for a total of no more than six months (anticipated Dec 1, 2032 - May 31, 2033). Solicitation number will be SPE603-22-R-0506. The pre-proposal conference will be held on Wednesday, May 18, 2022 commencing at 8:30 AM at: Naval Support Activity Souda Bay Greece Visitor Control Center (VCC) Mouzouras Rd., BLDG 85 American Base Chania, Crete, Greece 73100 All attendees must provide by email to the Contract Specialist, Wing Yi Wong, at wing.wong@dla.mil, on or before 3p.m. (US Eastern Time), April 28, 2022, the name(s) and company represented, of the individual(s) who plan to attend. In addition, foreign nationals must provide a copy of their passport ID (including the bio-data page) and a copy of company travel order. U.S. citizens must provide a copy of their U.S. passport (including the bio-data page) and a copy of company travel order. U.S. DOD Civilians and contractors must provide a copy of their DOD ID (front and back) and a copy of company travel order. *For Foreign Nationals, the processing time will take up to 3 weeks. This acquisition will be Full and Open Competition (unrestricted). DLA Energy will award one Firm-Fixed Price contract. Contract awarded will be subject to FAR 52.222-41, Service Contract Act of 1965. The North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) Code is 493190, and the size standard is $30 million.? All responsible offerors may submit an offer for consideration. Secure Documents Several documents related to this solicitation will be posted as "secured" in the www.Sam.gov website. Please find below instructions to access secured documents in www.Sam.gov. Instructions for access to the www.Sam.gov Secure Site: To access the secured, but unclassified, documents in the SAM.gov ("www.Sam.gov ") system, offerors must: Several documents related to this solicitation will be posted as "secured" in the https://sam.gov/ (Contract Opportunities). Please find below instructions to access secured documents in https:/sam.gov/ (Contract Opportunities). Instructions for access to the https://sam.gov/ (Contract Opportunities): To access the secured, but unclassified, documents in https://sam.gov/ (Contract Opportunities), offerors must: 1. Be registered in the System for Award Management (SAM). Please note that SAM has replaced the previous system Central Contractor Registration (CCR). If an entity was previously registered in CRR the information should have transferred into SAM. You just need to set up a SAM account and migrate your CCR roles. 2. Once registered in SAM, go to website at https://sam.gov/ (Contract Opportunities) and log in. Verify your registration within the SAM system. The https://beta.sam.gov/ learning guide is available at https://sam.gov/help/new-to-sam to provide assistance. NOTE:? PLEASE KEEP IN MIND ALL DATES ARE SUBJECT TO CHANGE!!!

title: Bituminous Paving and Repairs at Charles Hickey School
description:
This is an SBR project for roadway paving, driveway replacement and other miscellaneous repairs to pot holes, broken and cracked blacktop pavement at various locations at the Department of Juvenile Services, Charles Hickey School 9700 Old Harford Road Baltimore, Maryland 21234
Bids in response to this solicitation are due June 7, 2022 by 12:00 PM and must be submitted via email in an attachment in Microsoft Word format, version 2007 or greater or Adobe PDF format to Robert P. Gay, Procurement Officer at the following email address: Robert.gay@maryland.gov

category_id: Services: Transport, Logistics, Hauling, Shipping, Warehousing, Moving Bids
title: Government Owned Contractor Operated Alongside Aircraft Refueling Services
description: Defense Logistics Agency - Energy is issuing a Request for Proposal (RFP) for Alongside Aircraft Refueling Services to include managing, maintaining, and operating Government Owned Fuel Service Facilities and equipment at the Government Owned, Contractor-Operated (GOCO) facilities at Naval Air Station Souda Bay (NAS Souda Bay), Greece. ?Services include providing all technical support, personnel, supervision, equipment, tools, materials, and other items as required by the Performance Work Statement (PWS) on behalf of DLA Energy, in support of the Department of Navy. The vendor will be responsible to furnish, manage, maintain, and operate mobile fuel servicing equipment required to support the facilities, equipment, vehicles, and aircraft assigned to and as may transit, deploy to, or exercise at this location. The vendor will also be responsible to provide, maintain, and operate Contractor-Furnished Vehicles in support of aircraft and vehicles assigned or transient to NAS Souda Bay, Greece. DLA Energy will follow source selection procedures utilizing the Lowest Price Technically Acceptable (LPTA) evaluation process in accordance with FAR 15.101-2 for this acquisition. The requirement is a four-year base performance period from Dec 1, 2023 - Nov 30, 2027; five-year option period from Dec 1, 2027 - Nov 30, 2032, and option to extend the contract for a total of no more than six months (anticipated Dec 1, 2032 - May 31, 2033). Solicitation number will be SPE603-22-R-0506. The pre-proposal conference will be held on Wednesday, May 18, 2022 commencing at 8:30 AM at: Naval Support Activity Souda Bay Greece Visitor Control Center (VCC) Mouzouras Rd., BLDG 85 American Base Chania, Crete, Greece 73100 All attendees must provide by email to the Contract Specialist, Wing Yi Wong, at wing.wong@dla.mil, on or before 3p.m. (US Eastern Time), April 28, 2022, the name(s) and company represented, of the individual(s) who plan to attend. In addition, foreign nationals must provide a copy of their passport ID (including the bio-data page) and a copy of company travel order. U.S. citizens must provide a copy of their U.S. passport (including the bio-data page) and a copy of company travel order. U.S. DOD Civilians and contractors must provide a copy of their DOD ID (front and back) and a copy of company travel order. *For Foreign Nationals, the processing time will take up to 3 weeks. This acquisition will be Full and Open Competition (unrestricted). DLA Energy will award one Firm-Fixed Price contract. Contract awarded will be subject to FAR 52.222-41, Service Contract Act of 1965. The North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) Code is 493190, and the size standard is $30 million.? All responsible offerors may submit an offer for consideration. Secure Documents Several documents related to this solicitation will be posted as "secured" in the www.Sam.gov website. Please find below instructions to access secured documents in www.Sam.gov. Instructions for access to the www.Sam.gov Secure Site: To access the secured, but unclassified, documents in the SAM.gov ("www.Sam.gov ") system, offerors must: Several documents related to this solicitation will be posted as "secured" in the https://sam.gov/ (Contract Opportunities). Please find below instructions to access secured documents in https:/sam.gov/ (Contract Opportunities). Instructions for access to the https://sam.gov/ (Contract Opportunities): To access the secured, but unclassified, documents in https://sam.gov/ (Contract Opportunities), offerors must: 1. Be registered in the System for Award Management (SAM). Please note that SAM has replaced the previous system Central Contractor Registration (CCR). If an entity was previously registered in CRR the information should have transferred into SAM. You just need to set up a SAM account and migrate your CCR roles. 2. Once registered in SAM, go to website at https://sam.gov/ (Contract Opportunities) and log in. Verify your registration within the SAM system. The https://beta.sam.gov/ learning guide is available at https://sam.gov/help/new-to-sam to provide assistance. NOTE:? PLEASE KEEP IN MIND ALL DATES ARE SUBJECT TO CHANGE!!!

title: Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business (SDVOSB) Sole Source (FAR 19.14) Forklift Operator Support
description: THIS NOTICE OF INTENT IS NOT A REQUEST FOR QUOTES. A DETERMINATION NOT TO COMPETE THE PROPOSED PROCUREMENT BASED UPON RESPONSES TO THIS NOTICE IS SOLELY WITHIN THE DISCRETION OF THE GOVERNMENT. The Puget Sound Naval Shipyard and Intermediate Maintenance Facility (PSNS and IMF) Contracting Department (Code 400), hereby provides notice of its intent to award a sole-source, firm fixed service contract to SJS Executives, LLC, 2652 Excalibur Court, Virginia Beach VA 23454. The contract is expected to be awarded using FAR Part 13 procedures.? The period of performance shall be from 6 July 2022 to 16 September 2022. This requirement is to provide forklift operator support.? In accordance with 41 U.S.C. 1901 IAW FAR 13.5, and 15 U.S.C. 657(f) IAW FAR 19.1406. Authorized or Required by Statute, the Government is soliciting SJS Executives, LLC as ?a Service Disabled Veteran Owned Small Business (SDVOSB) sole source action.? The North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code for this work is 488320-? Marine Cargo Handling, with a Business Size Standard of $41,500,000.00.? The Product Service Code Class is V119- Transportation/Travel/Relocation- Transportation: Other THIS NOTICE OF INTENT IS NOT A REQUEST FOR COMPETITIVE QUOTES; no solicitation or RFQ will be forthcoming. However, interested parties may identify their interest and capability to respond to this requirement no later than June 03, 10:00am Pacific Standard Time. Interested parties are encouraged to furnish information by email only with subject line stating - RESPONSE TO INTENT TO SOLE SOURCE FOR N4523A22Q5703. A determination to compete this requirement, based upon responses to this notice, is solely within the discretion of the Government. Information received will normally be considered solely for the purpose of determining whether to conduct a competitive procurement. PSNS and IMF Contracting will NOT be responsible for any costs incurred by interested parties in responding to this notice of intent. Only written responses will be considered. All responses from responsible sources will be fully considered. As a result of analyzing responses to this notice of intent, the Government shall determine if a solicitation will be issued. Any prospective contractor must be registered in the System for Award Management (SAM) in order to be eligible for award. All documents submitted will not be returned. All interested parties shall submit clear and convincing documentation demonstrating their capabilities to satisfy the requirements listed above to Contract Specialist Carolyn Seim, by email at Carolym.m.seim1@navy.mil and Contracting Officer, George Rutt at George.rutt@navy.mil. The capability documentation should include general information and technical background describing in detail the prospective contractor's capabilities and experience that will demonstrate the ability to support these requirements.

category_id: Services: Transport, Logistics, Hauling, Shipping, Warehousing, Moving Bids
title: Layberthing of 2 ?G? Class LMSR Vessels, GORDON and GILLILAND, on the East Coast of the United States
description: Bid opeinging will be on Monday June 27th at 2pm EST.? Please send bids to: Henry Puppe U.S. DOT/Maritime Administration, MAR-380 1200 New Jersey Avenue SE. Mail Stop W28-201 Washington, DC 20590 This will be a MS Teams Bid Opening: Microsoft Teams meeting call in (audio only) +1 509-931-1572,,514286227# ? United States, Spokane Phone Conference ID: 514 286 227# The Maritime Administration (MARAD) requires services for the exclusive long-term safe layberthing for two (2) Large Medium Speed Ro/Ro?s (LMSR) vessels, GORDON and GILLILAND on the U.S. East Coast.? Although the layberth is intended for the vessel identified in this solicitation, the Government may substitute a vessel of a similar size or smaller. A Memorandum of Agreement (MOA) between the Department of the Defense (DoD) and the Department of Transportation (DOT) establishes that, in consideration of the National Defense and the American Merchant Marine, a mutual interest and responsibility exists for the joint establishment, maintenance and control of a Ready Reserve Force (RRF), which is an element of the National Defense Reserve Fleet (NDRF).? The ships of the RRF are maintained by MARAD in various states of readiness to meet common user lift requirements of the armed services in a contingency.? The RRF consists of 41 vessels as of October 15, 2021.
